name: ProjectMnemosyne
description: Skills marketplace for the HomericIntelligence agentic ecosystem

plugins.name: agent-coverage-check
plugins.description: Check agent configuration coverage across hierarchy levels and phases. Use to ensure complete agent system coverage.

plugins.name: agent-hierarchy-diagram
plugins.description: Generate visual hierarchy diagrams of agent system showing levels and delegation. Use for documentation or onboarding.

plugins.name: agent-validate-config
plugins.description: Validate agent YAML frontmatter and configuration. Use before committing agent changes or in CI.

plugins.name: centralized-path-constants
plugins.description: Create central path constants module to prevent hardcoded path inconsistencies. Use when multiple files construct the same paths differently, causing bugs during refactoring or resume scenarios.

plugins.name: codebase-consolidation
plugins.description: Systematic approach to finding and consolidating duplicate code, aligning implementations to consistent patterns, and documenting intentional type variations. Use when: analyzing codebase for duplicates, unifying implementations across modules, creating backward-compatible refactors.

plugins.name: doc-generate-adr
plugins.description: Generate Architecture Decision Records (ADRs) to document significant architectural decisions. Use when: (1) Making significant architectural decisions, (2) Choosing between technical alternatives, (3) Documenting design trade-offs.

plugins.name: doc-issue-readme
plugins.description: Post structured documentation to GitHub issue as a comment. Use when starting work on an issue to document approach and track progress.

plugins.name: doc-update-blog
plugins.description: Update development blog with implementation milestones, learnings, and progress. Use after completing major milestones or phases.

plugins.name: doc-validate-markdown
plugins.description: Validate markdown files for formatting, links, and style compliance using markdownlint. Use when: (1) Before committing documentation, (2) Markdown linting errors in CI, (3) Creating new documentation.

plugins.name: e2e-resume-refactor
plugins.description: Refactoring E2E test framework resume behavior with directory restructure and checkpoint schema upgrade

plugins.name: fix-resource-prompt-consistency
plugins.description: Workflow for fixing inconsistent root-level field mapping in tier configurations and enhancing resource prompt suffixes

plugins.name: generate-api-docs
plugins.description: Create API reference documentation from docstrings. Use when documenting public module interfaces.

plugins.name: generate-changelog
plugins.description: Create changelog from git commits. Use when preparing release notes.

plugins.name: generate-docstrings
plugins.description: Create docstrings for functions and classes. Use when documenting code APIs.

plugins.name: identify-architecture
plugins.description: Analyze ML model architecture from papers and code. Use when understanding model structure for implementation.

plugins.name: implementation-alignment-validation
plugins.description: Use when validating that implementation code matches research documentation, design specs, or theoretical frameworks. Triggers: 'validate implementation', 'check alignment', 'docs vs code', 'implementation matches theory', 'verify against research'.

plugins.name: implementation-theory-alignment
plugins.description: Use when validating implementation code against research documentation, design specs, or theory papers. Triggers: 'validate implementation', 'align with docs', 'check against research', 'implementation matches theory'. Provides systematic workflow for identifying discrepancies and implementing fixes.

plugins.name: phase-plan-generate
plugins.description: Generate comprehensive plan documentation following Template 1 format. Use when creating plan.md files for new components or subsections.

plugins.name: plan-create-component
plugins.description: DEPRECATED: The notes/plan/ directory has been removed. Planning is now done directly through GitHub issues. See gh-read-issue-context and gh-post-issue-update skills instead.

plugins.name: plan-regenerate-issues
plugins.description: DEPRECATED: The notes/plan/ directory has been removed. Planning is now done directly through GitHub issues. See gh-read-issue-context and gh-post-issue-update skills instead.

plugins.name: plan-validate-structure
plugins.description: DEPRECATED: The notes/plan/ directory has been removed. Planning is now done directly through GitHub issues. See gh-read-issue-context and gh-post-issue-update skills instead.

plugins.name: quality-complexity-check
plugins.description: Analyze code complexity metrics including cyclomatic complexity and nesting depth. Use when: (1) Code review process, (2) Identifying refactoring candidates, (3) Maintaining code quality standards.

plugins.name: quality-security-scan
plugins.description: Scan code for security vulnerabilities and unsafe patterns. Use when: (1) Before committing code with secrets, (2) Security review process, (3) Pre-release security audit.

plugins.name: shared-fixture-migration
plugins.description: Migrate duplicated test fixture configs to a centralized shared location with runtime loading. Use when: test fixtures contain config files duplicated across many test directories, the same config content is repeated for each test but is actually test-independent, you want a single source of truth for shared configurations.

plugins.name: track-implementation-progress
plugins.description: Track implementation progress against plan. Use to monitor component delivery and identify blockers.

plugins.name: batch-pr-ci-fix
plugins.description: Batch fix CI failures across multiple PRs and enable auto-merge. Use when: (1) Multiple PRs have CI failures, (2) Need to fix common failure patterns, (3) Want to auto-merge PRs after CI passes. Handles broken links, formatting issues, mypy errors.

plugins.name: build-run-local
plugins.description: Run local builds with proper environment setup matching CI pipeline. Use when: (1) Building code locally before pushing, (2) Verifying changes work before creating PR, (3) Debugging build issues in isolation.

plugins.name: ci-failure-workflow
plugins.description: Complete CI failure debugging workflow. Contains 2 sub-skills: (1) analyze - parse CI logs to identify root causes and error patterns, (2) fix - systematic workflow to reproduce, fix, and verify CI issues. Use when CI checks fail on PR.

plugins.name: fix-ci-mojo-test-failure
plugins.description: TRIGGER CONDITIONS: (1) CI failing with Mojo test assertion error, (2) test expects specific return value but implementation returns different value, (3) edge case handling missing in implementation. Verified on ProjectOdyssey PR #3050.

plugins.name: fix-docker-image-case
plugins.description: Fix Docker SBOM and workflow failures caused by mixed-case image names in GitHub Actions. Use when: SBOM generation fails with 'could not parse reference' errors, Docker workflows fail with case-related parsing issues.

plugins.name: fix-docker-platform
plugins.description: Fix Docker build failures caused by platform mismatches. Use when: (1) Docker builds fail with 'unsupported platform' errors, (2) pixi install fails in Docker with linux-aarch64 errors, (3) Multi-arch builds fail when pixi.toml only supports one platform.

plugins.name: fix-docker-shell-tty
plugins.description: Fix Docker interactive shell failures caused by missing TTY flags. Use when: (1) docker compose exec or docker exec fails for interactive shells, (2) justfile shell recipe doesn't work, (3) Terminal input/output not working in containerized shells. Root cause: -T flag disables TTY when -it flags are needed.

plugins.name: fix-ruff-linting-errors
plugins.description: Comprehensive workflow for fixing all ruff linting errors in CI/CD pipelines

plugins.name: gh-check-ci-status
plugins.description: Check CI/CD status of a pull request including workflow runs and test results. Use when: (1) Verifying PR checks are passing before merge, (2) Investigating CI failures, (3) Monitoring long-running CI jobs.

plugins.name: github-actions-mojo
plugins.description: GitHub Actions CI setup for Mojo projects. Use when: (1) Setting up Mojo CI/CD, (2) Configuring pixi with GitHub Actions, (3) Running mojo test in CI.

plugins.name: github-actions-pytest-pixi
plugins.description: GitHub Actions CI setup for pytest projects using pixi. Use when: (1) Setting up CI/CD for Python projects with pixi, (2) Need parallel test execution with matrix strategy, (3) Adding automated testing to existing repos, (4) Configuring coverage reporting in CI.

plugins.name: install-workflow
plugins.description: Create GitHub Actions workflows for automated package building and distribution. Use in package phase to automate .mojopkg building and release creation.

plugins.name: pr-merge-conflict-resolution
plugins.description: Systematic workflow for rebasing PRs and resolving merge conflicts. Use when: (1) PR branch is behind main with conflicts, (2) bulk-fixing frontmatter conflicts across many files, (3) resolving conflicts between new and existing fields.

plugins.name: quality-fix-formatting
plugins.description: Automatically fix code formatting issues using mojo format, markdownlint, and pre-commit hooks. Use when formatting checks fail or before committing code.

plugins.name: run-precommit
plugins.description: Run pre-commit hooks locally to validate code quality before committing. Use when: (1) Before committing code, (2) Testing if CI will pass, (3) After making code changes.

plugins.name: scan-vulnerabilities
plugins.description: Detect security vulnerabilities in code and dependencies. Use when auditing security.

plugins.name: validate-workflow
plugins.description: Validate GitHub Actions workflow files for syntax and correctness. Use when: (1) Creating or modifying workflows, (2) Workflow syntax errors occur, (3) Before committing workflow changes.

plugins.name: verify-pr-ready
plugins.description: Verify PR is ready for merge with all requirements met. Use when: (1) Before merging a PR manually, (2) Validating PR readiness in batch operations, (3) Checking branch protection rule compliance.

plugins.name: yaml-frontmatter-validation
plugins.description: Fix CI failures caused by missing YAML frontmatter in SKILL.md files. Use when: (1) plugin validation fails with 'missing YAML frontmatter' errors, (2) multiple PRs failing with same root cause, (3) SKILL.md doesn't start with '---', (4) systematic fixes needed across main and feature branches.

plugins.name: analyze-code-structure
plugins.description: Examine code organization and identify structural patterns. Use when reviewing module design.

plugins.name: analyze-equations
plugins.description: Parse and interpret mathematical equations from research papers. Use when extracting formulas for implementation.

plugins.name: detect-code-smells
plugins.description: Identify code quality issues and anti-patterns. Use when reviewing code for maintainability problems.

plugins.name: e2e-rate-limit-detection
plugins.description: Debugging rate limit detection when error messages appear in JSON response fields instead of stderr. Use when rate limits from API responses aren't being caught, especially for Claude CLI JSON output with is_error:true.

plugins.name: extract-algorithm
plugins.description: Parse and document algorithm pseudocode from research papers. Use when preparing for implementation.

plugins.name: extract-hyperparameters
plugins.description: Identify and document model hyperparameters from papers. Use when setting up training configurations.

plugins.name: fix-implicitlycopyable-removal
plugins.description: Systematic approach to removing ImplicitlyCopyable trait from Mojo structs and fixing resulting compilation errors. Use when: removing ImplicitlyCopyable from structs with List/Dict/String fields, fixing 'cannot implicitly copy' errors, debugging memory corruption from bitwise copies.

plugins.name: fix-randn-seed-bug
plugins.description: Fix unused seed parameter in random number generation functions. Use when: (1) Tests using seeded random inputs produce non-reproducible results, (2) randn/random functions declare seed parameter but generate different values each call, (3) assert_almost_equal fails with wildly different values for same-seeded inputs.

plugins.name: fixme-todo-cleanup
plugins.description: Systematic FIXME/TODO cleanup workflow with proper branching, PRs, and CI handling

plugins.name: global-semaphore-parallelism
plugins.description: Debugging and implementing global parallelism control using multiprocessing.Manager().Semaphore() to limit concurrent agents across all tiers

plugins.name: orphan-branch-recovery
plugins.description: Use when a branch has no common ancestor with main, cannot be merged, or was pushed from the wrong repository. Triggers: 'no merge base', 'branch diverged completely', 'cannot merge unrelated histories', 'pushed from wrong repo'. Provides workflow for diagnosing orphan branches and recovering valuable content.

plugins.name: pydantic-model-dump
plugins.description: Fix Pydantic v2 model serialization using .model_dump() instead of .to_dict(). Use when encountering AttributeError on Pydantic BaseModel objects during JSON serialization.

plugins.name: resume-crash-debugging
plugins.description: Pattern for debugging resume crashes in long-running experiments with checkpoint systems. Use when: (1) experiments crash on resume with FileNotFoundError or similar, (2) file path mismatches between validation and loading, (3) need to diagnose progressive degradation (works 1st time, fails on Nth resume), (4) checkpoint state is out of sync with filesystem.

plugins.name: retry-transient-errors
plugins.description: Pattern for adding exponential backoff retry logic to handle transient network and I/O errors

plugins.name: complex-agent-eval-task
plugins.description: Create sophisticated E2E test cases for AI agents using real PRs as reference solutions. Use when: (1) designing T2+ tier evaluation tasks, (2) need patchfile-based evaluation against reference, (3) testing agents on complex refactoring/migration tasks, (4) constraining agents from accessing solution sources.

plugins.name: create-swe-bench-tests
plugins.description: Create SWE-bench style benchmark test cases from repository PR history. Use when: (1) Setting up AI agent evaluation infrastructure, (2) Creating benchmark suites from real PRs, (3) Building ablation test frameworks with tier configurations.

plugins.name: e2e-agent-judge-timing
plugins.description: Add separate agent and judge timing fields to E2E test results for tiebreaker ranking. Use when implementing timing metrics in evaluation frameworks with multi-stage pipelines (agent execution + judging).

plugins.name: e2e-checkpoint-resume
plugins.description: Implementing checkpoint/resume with rate limit handling for E2E evaluation frameworks

plugins.name: e2e-judge-rubric-design
plugins.description: Design LLM-as-Judge evaluation rubrics for E2E agent testing. Use when: (1) Building agent evaluation systems with LLM judges, (2) Designing weighted scoring criteria for code quality, (3) Handling invalid evaluations (rate limits, errors) distinctly from failures, (4) Standardizing judge prompts across test runs.

plugins.name: evaluate-model
plugins.description: Measure model performance on test datasets. Use when assessing accuracy, precision, recall, and other metrics.

plugins.name: judge-criteria-enhancement
plugins.description: Adding proportionality criteria to LLM judge systems to penalize over-engineering and reward task-appropriate solutions

plugins.name: judge-system-extension
plugins.description: Patterns for extending AI evaluation/judge systems with consensus retry, cleanup evaluation, cross-tier analysis, and container orchestration. Use when: (1) Adding new evaluation capabilities to a judge system, (2) Implementing consensus-based scoring with disagreement handling, (3) Creating container-based isolation for evaluators, (4) Adding cross-tier statistical analysis.

plugins.name: plan-review-interview
plugins.description: Structured interview workflow for reviewing implementation plans. Use when: (1) You have a draft plan that needs stakeholder validation, (2) GitHub issues exist but lack key decision details, (3) You need to systematically identify gaps before implementation, (4) You want to document decisions alongside affected issues.

plugins.name: prepare-dataset
plugins.description: Process and validate datasets for training. Use when setting up data pipelines.

plugins.name: tier-ablation-testing
plugins.description: Methodology for running comprehensive tier ablation studies across AI agent architectures (T0-T6)

plugins.name: token-stats-aggregation
plugins.description: Pattern for tracking detailed token statistics with cache tokens across hierarchical E2E report levels

plugins.name: analyze-simd-usage
plugins.description: Analyze SIMD usage opportunities in Mojo code. Use to find performance optimization opportunities.

plugins.name: benchmark-functions
plugins.description: Measure function performance and compare implementations. Use when optimizing critical code paths.

plugins.name: checkpoint-result-validation
plugins.description: Validate checkpoint results before resuming expensive operations to prevent wasted API calls. Use when implementing resume/checkpoint systems that need to skip already-completed work.

plugins.name: mojo-simd-optimize
plugins.description: Apply SIMD optimizations to Mojo code for parallel computation. Use when optimizing performance-critical tensor and array operations.

plugins.name: profile-code
plugins.description: Measure execution time and memory usage of code. Use when analyzing performance characteristics.

plugins.name: suggest-optimizations
plugins.description: Identify performance optimization opportunities. Use when improving code efficiency.

plugins.name: agent-test-delegation
plugins.description: Test agent delegation patterns to verify hierarchy and escalation paths. Use after modifying agent structure.

plugins.name: calculate-coverage
plugins.description: Measure test coverage and identify untested code. Use when assessing test completeness.

plugins.name: check-memory-safety
plugins.description: Check Mojo code for memory safety issues (ownership violations, use-after-free, etc.). Use to catch memory bugs.

plugins.name: create-review-checklist
plugins.description: Generate customized review checklists based on type of change. Use when: (1) Starting PR review for unfamiliar change type, (2) Need specific checklist for code vs tests vs docs, (3) Large multi-type changes needing organized review.

plugins.name: deduplicate-test-fixtures
plugins.description: Eliminate duplicated test fixture files by using runtime block-based composition. Use when: test fixtures contain many copies of the same file across directories, repository size is growing due to duplication, you want single source of truth for shared content.

plugins.name: extract-dependencies
plugins.description: Analyze imports and identify all module dependencies. Use when mapping project structure.

plugins.name: extract-test-failures
plugins.description: Extract and summarize test failures from logs. Use when: (1) CI test run failed, need to understand failures, (2) Large test suite with many failures needs summary, (3) Categorizing failures by type (assertion, runtime, timeout).

plugins.name: fix-placeholder-code-ci
plugins.description: Fix CI failures caused by partially commented placeholder code and dtype migration assertion mismatches

plugins.name: generate-fix-suggestions
plugins.description: Generate fix suggestions based on error patterns and best practices. Use when: (1) Test failures need concrete solutions, (2) Build errors require remediation steps, (3) Creating PR comments with suggestions.

plugins.name: generate-tests
plugins.description: Create test cases for functions and modules. Use when implementing TDD or improving coverage.

plugins.name: lint-code
plugins.description: Check code for style and quality issues. Use when validating code before commits.

plugins.name: mojo-lint-syntax
plugins.description: Validate Mojo syntax against current v0.26.1+ standards. Use to catch syntax errors before compilation.

plugins.name: mojo-memory-check
plugins.description: Verify memory safety in Mojo code including ownership, borrowing, and lifetime management. Use when reviewing code or debugging memory issues.

plugins.name: mojo-test-runner
plugins.description: Run Mojo tests using mojo test command. Use when executing tests or verifying test coverage.

plugins.name: mojo-type-safety
plugins.description: Validate type safety in Mojo code including parametric types and trait constraints. Use during code review or when type errors occur.

plugins.name: phase-cleanup
plugins.description: Refactor and finalize code after parallel phases complete, addressing technical debt. Use in cleanup phase to polish code before merge.

plugins.name: phase-test-tdd
plugins.description: Generate test files and coordinate test-driven development (TDD). Use when creating tests before implementation or during test phase.

plugins.name: quality-coverage-report
plugins.description: Generate test coverage reports showing which code paths are tested. Use to identify untested code and improve test coverage.

plugins.name: quality-run-linters
plugins.description: Run all configured linters including mojo format, markdownlint, and pre-commit hooks. Use before committing code to ensure quality standards are met.

plugins.name: refactor-code
plugins.description: Restructure code for improved clarity and maintainability. Use when addressing code smells or technical debt.

plugins.name: resume-functionality-tests
plugins.description: Comprehensive test patterns for checkpoint/resume systems covering crash, interrupt, and partial completion scenarios. Use when testing long-running processes with resume capability.

plugins.name: review-pr-changes
plugins.description: Review PR changes with structured checklist for quality and standards compliance. Use for comprehensive PR code review.

plugins.name: run-tests
plugins.description: Execute test suites and report results. Use when validating code functionality.

plugins.name: test-diff-analyzer
plugins.description: Analyze test differences between runs to identify flaky tests. Use when: (1) Test passes locally but fails in CI, (2) Test sometimes passes, sometimes fails, (3) Need to understand test consistency issues.

plugins.name: validate-inputs
plugins.description: Check function inputs for correctness and safety. Use when implementing defensive programming.

plugins.name: validate-mojo-patterns
plugins.description: Validate Mojo code patterns (out self, mut, List, etc.) against best practices. Use to ensure code follows project standards.

plugins.name: agent-hooks-pattern
plugins.description: Pattern for agent-scoped lifecycle hooks in Claude Code v2.1.0. Use when: (1) implementing custom agents with safety controls, (2) restricting agent tool access, (3) adding PreToolUse/PostToolUse/Stop hooks to agents.

plugins.name: agent-run-orchestrator
plugins.description: Run section orchestrators to coordinate multi-component workflows. Use when starting work on a section.

plugins.name: ai-blog-generator
plugins.description: Generate AI-authored blog posts from git commit history. Use when: (1) Filling gaps in project blog history, (2) Need to document past work retroactively, (3) Creating development blog posts based on actual commits, (4) Backfilling documentation for dates without posts.

plugins.name: bulk-issue-filing
plugins.description: Bulk create GitHub issues from code markers (TODO/FIXME/DEPRECATED/NOTE). Use when: (1) Cleaning up technical debt markers across codebase, (2) Need to systematically track all TODO/FIXME items, (3) Creating master tracking issues with child issues for large cleanup efforts.

plugins.name: check-dependencies
plugins.description: Validate and verify dependencies are available and compatible. Use when setting up environments.

plugins.name: claude-code-v21-adoption
plugins.description: Systematic approach to adopting Claude Code v2.1.0 features in skills marketplace. Use when: (1) upgrading to new Claude Code version, (2) analyzing CHANGELOG for feature adoption, (3) updating plugin schemas and templates, (4) creating documentation skills for new features.

plugins.name: claude-plugin-format
plugins.description: Official Claude Code plugin format requirements. Use when: (1) Creating a new plugin, (2) Debugging plugin validation errors, (3) Skills or commands not appearing after install.

plugins.name: claude-plugin-marketplace
plugins.description: Set up Claude Code plugin marketplaces. Use when: (1) Registering a skills marketplace, (2) Fixing plugin.json schema errors, (3) Understanding marketplace.json format, (4) Installing plugins from private repos.

plugins.name: execution-stage-logging
plugins.description: Add structured stage logging with timing to track worker thread progress through multi-stage pipelines. Use when parallel workers make it unclear what stage each is in or which workers are stuck.

plugins.name: generate-boilerplate
plugins.description: Create starter code from templates. Use when setting up new modules or test files.

plugins.name: gh-batch-merge-by-labels
plugins.description: Batch merge multiple PRs by label matching. Use when: (1) Multiple PRs ready for merge with same status label, (2) End-of-sprint or release batch merges, (3) Automating merge of dependent chain of PRs.

plugins.name: gh-create-pr-linked
plugins.description: Create PRs properly linked to GitHub issues. Use when: (1) Creating a PR that implements a specific issue, (2) Need automatic issue linking in PR, (3) Ready to submit changes for review after completing work.

plugins.name: gh-implement-issue
plugins.description: End-to-end implementation workflow for a GitHub issue from planning through PR creation. Use when starting work on an issue from scratch.

plugins.name: gh-post-issue-update
plugins.description: Post structured updates to GitHub issues for progress tracking. Use when: (1) Reporting implementation progress, (2) Documenting design decisions, (3) Posting completion summaries or findings.

plugins.name: gh-pr-review-workflow
plugins.description: Complete PR review feedback workflow. Contains 3 sub-skills: (1) get-comments - fetch all review comments from PR, (2) reply-comment - reply to individual review comments, (3) fix-feedback - full workflow to address and reply to all feedback. Use when addressing PR review comments.

plugins.name: gh-read-issue-context
plugins.description: Read context from GitHub issue including body and comments. Use when: (1) Before starting implementation work, (2) When prior context is needed, (3) Resuming work after a break and need to understand decisions made earlier.

plugins.name: gh-review-pr
plugins.description: Comprehensively review a pull request including code changes, CI status, and adherence to project standards. Use when asked to review a PR.

plugins.name: git-worktree-workflow
plugins.description: Complete git worktree workflow for parallel development. Contains 4 sub-skills: (1) create - create isolated worktrees for new issues, (2) switch - navigate between worktrees, (3) sync - keep worktrees up-to-date with main, (4) cleanup - remove worktrees after PR merge. Use when working on multiple issues in parallel without stashing.

plugins.name: graceful-signal-handling
plugins.description: Implement graceful shutdown for SIGINT/SIGTERM with checkpoint save and partial results. Use when long-running processes need to handle Ctrl+C without losing work.

plugins.name: mojo-build-package
plugins.description: Build Mojo packages (.mojopkg files) for distribution. Use when creating distributable libraries or during packaging phase.

plugins.name: mojo-format
plugins.description: Format Mojo code using mojo format command. Use when preparing code for commit or when formatting checks fail.

plugins.name: parallel-issue-implementation
plugins.description: Implement multiple GitHub issues in parallel using git worktrees. Use when you have 2+ issues with detailed plans ready for implementation.

plugins.name: phase-implement
plugins.description: Coordinate implementation phase by delegating tasks and ensuring code quality. Use during implementation phase to manage engineer tasks.

plugins.name: phase-package
plugins.description: Create distributable packages including .mojopkg files and archives. Use during package phase to prepare components for distribution.

plugins.name: plugin-generalization
plugins.description: Generalize skills/plugins for cross-repository compatibility. Use when: (1) plugins reference specific repos in frontmatter, (2) hardcoded paths need abstraction, (3) migrating a skills marketplace to support multiple projects.

plugins.name: retrospective-hook-integration
plugins.description: Setup SessionEnd hooks for automatic retrospective prompts in Claude Code. TRIGGER: (1) When integrating ProjectMnemosyne marketplace with another repository, (2) When setting up /advise and /retrospective skills, (3) When configuring automatic session-end knowledge capture. Verified on Claude Code with ProjectOdyssey integration.

plugins.name: skill-audit-and-merge
plugins.description: Systematic audit and consolidation of skills marketplace plugins. Use when: (1) Marketplace has grown with overlapping plugins, (2) Need to identify merge candidates, (3) Improving plugin discoverability via tags, (4) Reorganizing categories for better structure.

plugins.name: skills-agent-field
plugins.description: Pattern for specifying which agent type should execute a skill. Use when: (1) creating specialized skills for specific agents, (2) routing Mojo skills to syntax validators, (3) directing GitHub skills to implementation engineers.

plugins.name: skills-registry-commands
plugins.description: Complete skills registry system with 4 components: (1) /advise command - search skills before starting work, (2) /retrospective command - capture session learnings as new skills, (3) documentation-patterns skill - how to write effective skill docs, (4) validation-workflow skill - CI/CD for plugin validation. Use when setting up team knowledge capture or implementing the Sionic AI skills pattern.

plugins.name: technical-debt-tracker
plugins.description: Track and resolve FIXME/TODO comments by creating GitHub issues and updating stale references. Use when: (1) Auditing codebase for technical debt, (2) Creating structured issues for each debt category, (3) Updating stale issue references in comments.

plugins.name: tier-progress-indicators
plugins.description: Add real-time progress tracking for parallel tier execution to prevent 'appears hung' issues. Use when parallel workers make it unclear how many tasks are complete vs still running.

plugins.name: verify-issue-before-work
plugins.description: Verify GitHub issue state and existing implementation before starting work to avoid duplicate effort. Use when: starting work on issues, resuming after breaks, taking over from other sessions.

plugins.name: grpo-external-vllm
plugins.description: GRPO training with external vLLM server. Use when: (1) Running vLLM on separate GPUs, (2) Encountering vllm_skip_weight_sync errors, (3) OpenAI API parsing issues. Verified on gemma-3-12b-it.

plugins.name: spec-driven-experimentation
plugins.description: TECHSPEC.md pattern for structured ML experiments. Use when: (1) Planning parameter sweeps, (2) Defining success criteria before training, (3) Budget-constrained experiment design, (4) Hypothesis-driven ablation studies. Source: Sionic AI blog.

plugins.name: train-model
plugins.description: Execute model training with optimization algorithms. Use when running training loops on datasets.
